pros: Many good employees who have remained dedicated despite leadership, nice campus.
cons: Incompetent leadership has steered the school into debt. Check out Financial Responsibility Composite scores to see for yourself. The work environment can only be described as toxic and unhealthy. Enrollment is at an all time low but leader of that area continues to get promoted. Firing of employees seems indiscriminate. Many more have left on their own. Those who leave are not replaced and their work is dumped on those left behind. There's a hiring freeze but somehow the favorites are still getting positions filled. Policies are outdated by several years. Leadership is cutting benefits left and right and expecting employees to thank them. The best thing that could happen to PTC is to get in a union. The abuse would surely stop and employees would have some protections. Finally, the president does not know what she is doing but is quick to blame others. She requires employees to nominate her for lots of awards which she displays throughout her expensively renovated office. Low enrollment, college in debt, and employee morale at an all-time low equals poor leadership.

review_title: Horrible - Do not work there, don't attend
pros: Correctly nothing positive about this college
cons: This used to be an amazing college. I worked here for a long time. Under the leadership of President DeFeo and his team, the college was student focused and always one of the best places to work. The college had 2000 students and 800 residential students. The campus WAS lively and fun. Today there were only a few hundred students in the school. It's like walking into a morgue. Every employee hates it. We laugh at the decisions being made. It's a complete joke. The college is losing millions of dollars and we all know it will soon close. Employees quit almost daily. Turnover is the worst I have ever seen anywhere in my life. The current president is a self-centered, narcissistic person without an ounce of Emotional Intelligence or a clue of how to run an organization. Every decision is about her and not the students or faculty. It's a textbook disaster of leadership. The Board and this Administration are an embarrassment. The place will likely close soon.

pros: Benefits, atmosphere, leadership and coworkers were all great until a few years ago. Incompetent and divisive leadership has replaced many employees that have accumulated years with the college; only the worst of the worst remain.
cons: Institution is in deep, deep debt. Cuts, layoffs, and pay decreases abound. College will likely close sooner than later and go into bankruptcy. College is trying to sell off land to pay debts and praying loan is not called. Some adjuncts were not paid and morale is non existent. Adjunct pay is a fraction of other colleges. Run, run, run...

review_title: Good team from top to bottom
pros:
I was at PTI for about eight years in the student services department, and although there are some rough spots, it's an all around good place to work. The staff make each day as fun as work can be. The teamwork is awesome - everyone is always willing to help anyone. As I was leaving, some big changes were in the works, hence it now being called PTC, so everything seems to be going in the right direction! It's the kind of place you go back and visit due to the friendships you developed while there. 
While salary is slightly less than competitive, the benefits are fabulous.
cons: More opportunities for advancement for those who really want to contribute would be nice. There are some very long days, some odd hours in my previous position, but nothing too bad.

pros: Free education?  That's about it.  I literally cannot think of another pro to working here.
cons: Unless you want to work for a place that does not reward you based on accomplishment or merit, you should not work here.  Most of those in leadership are there because of who their friends are, who they've slept with, or how vested they are in the ESOP.  Compensation is minimal, but that's to be expected in the education industry.  Every day I was there I was harassed by my boss, emotionally, but since he thought it was funny, and he had made friends with all the right people, I was chastised.  While there, I lost a baby and had to miss 5 days of work.  Upon returning, my Director said, "We all have personal things we're going through, but you need to stop letting yours affect your work."  I checked out after that.
